newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Council strengthens rules on workplace carcinogens.
newsitem.headline: Council strengthens rules on workplace carcinogens.

text.p: The Social Affairs Council agreed new rules on Tuesday aimed at protecting workers from exposure to benzene, a cancer-causing chemical.
Benzene is a volatile liquid found in products such as coal tar and petroleum and used as a solvent and to make plastics.
The Council agreed to amend Directive 90/394/EEC on protecting workers from risks related to exposure to carginogens by setting limits for exposure to benzene.
It would affect, for example, workers in the oil refinery sector or tanker drivers, EU officials said.
The text would also extend the scope of the existing directive by redefining carcinogens to include products such as cosmetics, medicinal preparations and pesticides.
The Council's accord will be adopted as a formal common position as an "A" (nondiscussion) point once the text is finalised.
